tech.lity.rea.skatolo

Class SkatoloBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • tech.lity.rea.skatolo.SkatoloBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SkatoloConstants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Skatolo

    public class SkatoloBase
extends Object
implements SkatoloConstants
    The skatoloBase supports the skatolo class and implements all adder methods to add controllers to skatolo.

      • addSlider

        public Slider addSlider(Object theObject,
                        String theIndex,
                        String theName,
                        float theMin,
                        float theMax,
                        float theDefaultValue,
                        int theX,
                        int theY,
                        int theW,
                        int theH)
        Adds a slider to skatolo. by default it will be added to the default tab of the main window. Sliders can be arranged vertically and horizontally depending on their width and height. The look of a sliders control can either be a bar or a handle. you can add tickmarks to a slider or use the default free-control setting. A slider can be controller by mouse click, drag or mouse-wheel.

      • addKnob

        public Knob addKnob(Object theObject,
                    String theIndex,
                    String theName,
                    float theMin,
                    float theMax,
                    float theDefaultValue,
                    int theX,
                    int theY,
                    int theDiameter)
        Knobs can use limited and endless revolutions, custom angles and starting points. There are 2 control areas for a knob, an area closer to the edge allows 'click-and-adjust' control, a click and drag action at the inside allows to gradually change the value of a know when dragged. A knob can be controller by mouse click, drag or mouse-wheel.

      • addKnob

        public Knob addKnob(String theName,
                    float theMin,
                    float theMax,
                    int theX,
                    int theY,
                    int theDiameter)

      • addControllersFor

        public SkatoloBase addControllersFor(processing.core.PApplet theApplet)

      • addControllersFor

        public SkatoloBase addControllersFor(String theAddressSpace,
                                     Object t)
        Adds controllers for a specific object using annotations.

        Uses a forward slash delimited address, for example:

        lets say the theAddressSpace parameter is set to "hello", and the Object (second parameter) contains an annotated field "x", addControllersFor("hello", o); will add a controller for field x with address /hello/x This address can be used with getController("/hello/x") to access the controller of that particular Object and field.

        public Controller<?> getController(String theName,
                                   Object theObject)

      • printPublicMethodsFor

        public static void printPublicMethodsFor(Class<?> theClass,
                                         String... thePattern)
        prints a list of public methods of requested class into the console. You can specify patterns that will print methods found with only these particular patterns in their name.

        printed Format: returnType methodName(parameter type)
